form.instruction:
You need to make sure the pronouns in your lexicon will be mapped to the syntactic category Pron (which will then be mapped again appropriately to the positions they can occur in the tree structure). Choose one of the following options, depending on your situation:
If you already have pronouns marked with the category Pron in your lexicon, nothing more needs to be done.
If pronouns are mixed in with another category in the lexicon, you either need to give them the category Pron in your morphological parser, or add the feature makePron to each appropriate entry in the lexicon so the category will be changed for the syntax. (If a particular entry can also be used as another syntactic category, make a separate lexical entry for each use.)
If you have pronouns marked in your lexicon with a distinct category all their own, but it is different from Pron, enter that category below so PAWS can map your morphological category to Pron.
Pron
